snippet: The Obama administration said its suggestions would empower consumers regarding use of their personal data gleaned from Internet searches.
abstract: Obama administration outlines a set of online privacy principles that officials say will help consumers control the use of their personal data gleaned from Internet searches; framework for a new privacy code moves electronic commerce closer to a one-click, one-touch process by which users can tell Internet companies whether they want their online activity tracked.

headline.main: White House, Consumers in Mind, Offers Online Privacy Guidelines
headline.print_headline: White House, Consumers in Mind, Offers Online Privacy Guidelines

snippet: Smartphones may some day help people take better control of their health by tracking it with increasing precision and convenience.
abstract: Smartphones may some day help people take better control of their health by tracking it with increasing precision and convenience; various do-it-yourself health apps are highlighted.

headline.main: Monitoring Your Health With Mobile Devices
headline.print_headline: Monitoring Your Health With Mobile Devices

snippet: At Four Season Farm, Eliot Coleman and Barbara Damrosch continue to innovate and thrive.
abstract: Eliot Coleman and Barbara Damrosch, who run the organic Four Season Farm in Penobscot Bay, Me, describe how their business continues to thrive with the use of movable greenhouses, known as hoop houses, to grow vegetables into the cold months.

snippet: Apple must be thrilled to be selling millions of iPhones and iPads, but the company has to handle every new device pulling data from its cloud service. So it's not surprising that it has plans to build another data center.
abstract: Apple must be thrilled to be selling millions of iPhones and iPads, but the company has to handle every new device pulling data from its cloud service. So it's not surprising that it has plans to build another data center.

headline.main: Apple Plans New Data Center in Oregon

snippet: A selection of smartphone apps allow users to create their own ringtones.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column highlights a selection of smartphone apps that allow users to create their own ringtones.

headline.main: From Tunes to Tones, Apps Bridge the Gap
headline.print_headline: From Tunes to Tones, Apps Bridge the Gap

snippet: Excelsior is unlike any other store in Milan, and although aesthetically something of an eyesore, it has a remarkable selection of fashion and home designs.
abstract: Excelsior, a flashy 40,000-square-foot concept store in Milan, Italy, features a remarkable selection of designer fashion and accessories.

snippet: Amazon pulled more than 4,000 e-books distributed by the Independent Publishers Group off its site this week after it failed to exact better terms from the distributor.
abstract: Amazon pulled more than 4,000 e-books distributed by the Independent Publishers Group off its site this week after it failed to exact better terms from the distributor.

headline.main: Amazon Pulls Thousands of E-Books in Dispute
headline.print_headline: Unwilling to Back Down, Amazon Removes Thousands of a Distributor’s E-Books

snippet: The decline, in Meg Whitman’s first full quarter in charge, cut across all divisions. Dell Computer also reported lower net income.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard reports that net income fell sharply and warns of continued weakness; fiscal first-quarter profit was $1.5 billion, or 73 cents a share, down 44 percent from $3 billion, or $1.17 a share, in year-ago quarter; Dell Computer reports fourth-quarter profit of $764 million, or 43 cents a share, down 18 percent from year-ago quarter.

headline.main: H.P. Revenue and Profit Fall; More Trouble Is Expected
headline.print_headline: H.P. Revenue and Profit Fall; More Trouble Is Expected

snippet: Kamala D. Harris said the agreement will strengthen privacy protections for smartphone owners who download mobile applications by forcing developers to post conspicuous privacy policies.
abstract: Kamala D. Harris said the agreement will strengthen privacy protections for smartphone owners who download mobile applications by forcing developers to post conspicuous privacy policies.

headline.main: Apple, Google and Others in Agreement on App Privacy

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and NICK BILTON
